decision_conditions: The proposed development would by reason of the non-subservient side extension to the property would cause harm to the character and appearance of the host dwelling. As such, the proposal is contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document 2008, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document 2011 and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan 2016.

The proposed loft conversion including the hip to gable roof conversion and rear dormer window by reason of their scale, bulk and mass appear as an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the street scene and rear garden harmful to the appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document 2008, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document 2011 and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan 2016.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were sought with the agent John Pittaway. However, the revision or feedback was not received after two weeks.
description: Two storey side and single storey rear extension. Loft conversion with rear dormer and 2No. front roof light windows.
